FuncDef:
The ssl minimum version command sets the minimum SSL version used for an SSL policy.
The undo ssl minimum version command restores the SSL version used for an SSL policy is TLS1.2.
By default, the minimum SSL version used for an SSL policy is TLS1.2.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifiesthe minimum SSL version used for an SSL policy is TLS1.1.
-

Specifiesthe minimum SSL version used for an SSL policy is TLS1.2.
-

Specifies the minimum SSL version used for an SSL policy is TLS1.3.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set a minimum SSL version for an SSL policy, run the ssl minimum version command, which meets service modules' flexible requirements on the version of an SSL policy.
SSL policies support three SSL versions: TLS1.1, TLS1.2 and TLS1.3. TLS1.3 ensures the highest security, followed by TLS1.2, TLS1.1. The TLS1.1 is not secure now, and the TLS1.3 is recommended.
